accessibility 0.0.09
  • Reference

Floating catchment area accessibilitt

Source: R/floating_catchment_area.R
floating_catchment_area.Rd

Calculates accessibility accouting for the competition of resources using one of the multiple accessibility metrics in the floating catchment area family. The function currently includes 2SFCA and BFCA

floating_catchment_area(
  data,
  fca_metric,
  orig_col,
  dest_col,
  population_col,
  opportunity_col,
  decay_function,
  cutoff = NULL,
  decay_value = NULL
)

Arguments

data

A data.frame with a travel time matrix in long format, containing the at least the columns of origin from_id, destination to_id, travel time travel_time from origin to destination, and number of opportunities in destination locations.

fca_metric

A string indicating which floating cacthment area accessibility measure to use. Options avaiblable: "2SFCA" and "BFCA".

orig_col

A string with the name of the column of origin ids.

dest_col

A string with the name of the column of destination ids.

population_col

A string with the name of the column of origin with population count.

opportunity_col

A string with the name of the column of destination with the number of opportunities / resources / services.

decay_function

A string. Which decay function to use when calculating accessibility. One of step, exponential, fixed_exponential, linear or logistic. Please see the details to understand how each alternative works and how they relate to the cutoffs and decay_value parameters.

cutoff

A numeric vector. This parameter has different effects for each decay function: it indicates the cutoff times in minutes when calculating cumulative opportunities accessibility with the step function...

decay_value

A number. Extra parameter to be passed to the selected decay_function. Has no effects when decay_function is either step or exponential.

Value

A numeric estimate of accessibility.

See also

Other Floating catchment area: fca_2sfca(), fca_bfca()

Examples

library(accessibility)

# load a travel time matrix data in long format
data_path <- system.file("extdata/ttm_bho.rds", package = "accessibility")
ttm <- readRDS(data_path)

# 2SFCA with a step decay function
df <- floating_catchment_area(
       data = ttm,
       fca_metric = '2SFCA',
       orig_col = 'from_id',
       dest_col = 'to_id',
       opportunity_col = 'jobs',
       population_col = 'population',
       decay_function = 'step',
       cutoff = 30
       )
head(df)
#>            from_id access_2sfca
#> 1: 89a88cdb57bffff    0.1135253
#> 2: 89a88cdb597ffff    0.4412146
#> 3: 89a88cdb5b3ffff    0.4645848
#> 4: 89a88cdb5cfffff    0.3579043
#> 5: 89a88cd909bffff    0.2067682
#> 6: 89a88cd90b7ffff    0.2601425

# BFCA with a step decay function
df <- floating_catchment_area(
       data = ttm,
       fca_metric = 'BFCA',
       orig_col = 'from_id',
       dest_col = 'to_id',
       opportunity_col = 'jobs',
       population_col = 'population',
       decay_function = 'step',
       cutoff = 30
       )
head(df)
#>            from_id access_bfca
#> 1: 89a88cdb57bffff   0.1045731
#> 2: 89a88cdb597ffff   0.5069667
#> 3: 89a88cdb5b3ffff   0.5192616
#> 4: 89a88cdb5cfffff   0.4011974
#> 5: 89a88cd909bffff   0.2317942
#> 6: 89a88cd90b7ffff   0.2539631

df2 <- floating_catchment_area(data = ttm,
        fca_metric = '2SFCA',
        orig_col = 'from_id',
        dest_col = 'to_id',
        opportunity_col = 'jobs',
        population_col = 'population',
        decay_function = 'negative_exponential',
        decay_value = 0.5
        )

head(df2)
#>            from_id access_2sfca
#> 1: 89a88cdb57bffff   0.09719680
#> 2: 89a88cdb597ffff   0.25341503
#> 3: 89a88cdb5b3ffff   0.07677021
#> 4: 89a88cdb5cfffff   0.10922532
#> 5: 89a88cd909bffff   0.08838406
#> 6: 89a88cd90b7ffff   0.84150290
